MCodeNLPCommunicationRules.Description: GPT translation rules for converting emails and website copy to align with specific MCode Dimensions using NLP techniques. Each dimension has specific linguistic patterns, meta programs, and communication preferences that maximize engagement and persuasion.

GeneralPrinciples.Principle: Maintain the core message while transforming language patterns to match dimensional preferences
Write in 10th grade reading level vocabulary to make all the content approachable
Use sensory-specific language that resonates with each dimension's processing style
Apply appropriate meta programs to frame information in compelling ways
Match energy levels and communication pace to dimensional preferences
Create emotional anchors that connect to dimensional motivations
Use presuppositions and embedded commands aligned with dimensional drives

Dimension.name: Achiever
Dimension.Core_Motivation: Personal excellence, recognition, standing out, measurable success

Translation_Rules.Rule: Replace generic success language with specific achievement metrics and recognition-focused terms
Transform "we" statements into "you" statements emphasizing individual accomplishment
Convert process descriptions into outcome-focused benefits that highlight excellence
Reframe collaborative language to emphasize how individual contribution stands out within team success
Transform time-based benefits into performance-based advantages
Convert feature lists into "ways to excel" or "paths to distinction"
Replace industry standard claims with "industry-leading" or "best-in-class" positioning
Transform problem-solving language into opportunity-to-excel framing

Linguistic_Patterns.Visual_Predicates: see your success, picture excellence, visualize standing out, spotlight your achievements, highlight your distinction
Linguistic_Patterns.Power_Verbs: excel, distinguish, outperform, achieve, dominate, lead, surpass, master, elevate, maximize
Linguistic_Patterns.Achievement_Anchors: recognition, excellence, distinction, superiority, mastery, prominence, leadership, success metrics
Linguistic_Patterns.Embedded_Commands: excel beyond expectations, distinguish yourself clearly, achieve remarkable results, maximize your potential

Framing_Strategies.Strategy: Outcome frames: "How will this make you stand out in your field?"
Comparison frames: "While others settle for average, you can achieve excellence"
Recognition frames: "Your achievements will be noticed and celebrated"
Mastery frames: "Master this skill to become industry-leading"

Avoid.Pattern: Collaborative language that diminishes individual contribution
Process-heavy descriptions without clear achievement outcomes
Generic benefits that don't emphasize distinction or excellence
Team-first messaging that overshadows personal accomplishment

Dimension.name: Driver
Dimension.Core_Motivation: Forward momentum, overcoming challenges, achieving goals, breaking through obstacles

Translation_Rules.Rule: Convert passive language into action-oriented, momentum-building statements
Transform benefits into "breakthrough" and "advancement" opportunities
Reframe obstacles as challenges to overcome rather than problems to solve
Convert timeline language into urgency and forward-motion messaging
Transform feature descriptions into "ways to drive results" or "tools for advancement"
Replace collaborative language with leadership and initiative-taking messaging
Convert maintenance benefits into growth and progression advantages
Reframe support services as "acceleration tools" or "momentum builders"

Linguistic_Patterns.Kinesthetic_Predicates: push through, drive forward, break barriers, build momentum, accelerate progress, power ahead
Linguistic_Patterns.Power_Verbs: advance, overcome, conquer, achieve, drive, push, accelerate, breakthrough, pursue, dominate
Linguistic_Patterns.Motion_Anchors: momentum, progress, advancement, breakthrough, acceleration, achievement, conquest, drive
Linguistic_Patterns.Embedded_Commands: drive toward your goals, push through obstacles, accelerate your progress, achieve breakthrough results

Framing_Strategies.Strategy: Challenge frames: "What obstacle can we help you overcome?"
Progress frames: "How quickly can you advance toward your goal?"
Momentum frames: "Build unstoppable momentum in your market"
Achievement frames: "Drive results faster than ever before"

Avoid.Pattern: Passive, slow-paced language that lacks urgency
Maintenance-focused messaging without growth implications
Complex, detailed explanations that slow momentum
Risk-averse language that suggests hesitation or delay

Reframe product benefits as "ways to make an impact" or "methods to create change"
Transform ROI language into "influence metrics" and "relationship value"
Convert technical specifications into "connection capabilities" and "engagement features"
Reframe competitive advantages as "ways to lead and inspire your market"
Transform efficiency benefits into "more time for relationship building"
Convert problem-solving into "opportunity to guide others through challenges"

Implementation_Guidelines.Guideline: Identify the recipient's primary dimension through assessment, observation, or strategic questioning
Maintain the core factual content while transforming language patterns and emphasis
Use multiple techniques from the dimension's toolkit rather than relying on single patterns
Test different approaches when the dimension is unclear or when addressing multiple dimensions
Combine dimension-specific language with universal persuasion principles for maximum impact
Calibrate language intensity to match the recipient's communication style and context
Consider secondary dimensions when crafting longer-form communications
Maintain authenticity while adapting language patterns to avoid sounding artificial
